event.title: PRIMA Theatre Presents "Chess"
event.shortdesc: Chess is a musical by two songwriters formerly with ABBA and lyrics by Tim Rice involving a romantic triangle within the setting of an international chess championship.

fulldesc.p: Description: Chess is a musical story involving a romantic triangle between two top players, an American and a Russian, in a world chess championship. A woman who manages one player falls in love with the other; all in the context of a Cold War struggle between the United States and the Soviet Union during a time when both countries were competing on the international chess stage for propaganda purposes. The first theatrical production of Chess opened in London's West End in 1986 and played for three years. This is a partially staged, concert version.
Ticket Information: Tickets are $22 and up. Tickets are available at www.primatheatre.com

event.location: The Ware Center at Millersville University Lancaster, 42 N. Prince St., Lancaster, PA 17603

event.title: Poet Mark Doty
event.shortdesc: Lancaster Literary Guild & Ann Barshinger present poet Mark Doty

fulldesc.p: Description: Lancaster Literary Guild & Ann Barshinger present poet Mark Doty on October 17 at 7:30 p.m., at The Ware Center at Millersville University Lancaster.

Biography: Mark Doty's Fire to Fire: New and Selected Poems, won the National Book Award for Poetry in 2008. His eight books of poems include "School of the Arts," "Source" and "My Alexandria." He has also published four volumes of nonfiction prose: "Still Life with Oysters and Lemon," "Heaven's Coast," "Firebird" and "Dog Years," which was a New York Times bestseller in 2007. Widely anthologized, his poems appear in The Norton Anthology of Contemporary American Poetry and many other collections. Doty's work has been honored by the National Book Critics Circle Award, the Los Angeles Times Book Prize, a Whiting Writers Award, two Lambda Literary Awards and the PEN/Martha Albrand Award for First Nonfiction. He is the only American poet to have received the T.S. Eliot Prize in the U.K., and has received fellowships from the Guggenheim, Ingram Merrill and Lila Wallace/Readers Digest Foundations and from the National Endowment for the Arts.
Ticket Information: Tickets are $15 and can be purchased by calling 717-431-4433.

Come out an have a great time!

event.title: Speaker: Eric D. Thomas
event.shortdesc: Eric D. Thomas: Youth activist, speaker, author and motivator

fulldesc.p: Description: Eric D. Thomas, youth activist, speaker, author and motivator, will be speaking on October 18 at 6 p.m., in the Reighard Multipurpose Room in the Student Memorial Center.

Biography: Renown speaker, educator, author, activist and minister, Eric Thomas is rising to national prominence by delivering a high energy message that tells youth through first hand experience how to live up to their full potential and greatness and by breaking the cycles of crime, hopelessness and despair that many face daily. Known for his engagingly personal approach, his messages are both dynamic and inspiring. When coupled with his own Cycle-Breaking experience, his blunt essays on reality and remarkable ability to reach even the most jaded of minds has helped thousands of youth nationwide become peak performers academically, spiritually and personally. Eric has electrified audiences ranging from Fortune 500 companies to urban educators, collegiate athletic programs and inner-city youth development agencies with the message of his own life's struggles and the principles, insights and strategies he used to overcome them.
Ticket Information: This event is free and open to the public.

event.title: Walk a Mile in Her Shoes
event.shortdesc: Walk a Mile in Her Shoes at Millersville University

fulldesc.p: Description: On Wednesday, October 19, men and women will gather to walk one mile in women's high-heeled shoes throughout Millersville University to protest rape, sexual assault and gender violence. The walk is being organized by the Elsie S. Shenk Wellness and Women's Program. A portion of the proceeds from sponsored walkers will benefit Domestic Violence Services of Lancaster County.

The opening ceremonies and on-site registration are scheduled to begin at 5 p.m. with the walk beginning at 5:30 p.m. Men, women, and children are invited to participate and walk-on registrants are welcome. Men are encouraged (but not required) to walk in women's shoes and participants are being asked to obtain a minimum of $10 in sponsorships. We encourage participants to bring their own high heels; however, a limited number will be available at the event to those who do not have their own.
Ticket Information: Registration is required. Registration and the start of the walk will take place outside of the Student Memorial Center, in between the Student Memorial Center and Gordinier Hall.

event.title: Humanities Film Series presents: Sophia's Journey
event.shortdesc: One Book, One Campus and Humanities Film Series presents Sophia's Journey

fulldesc.p: Description: The Humanities Film Series presents a screening of the film Sophia's Journey, by Dr. Changfu Chang, professor of communication and theatre at Millersville University, on October 20 at 7 p.m. in Myers Auditorium, McComsey Hall. This event is held in conjunction with the University's One Book, One Campus, which is hosting multiple programs throughout the academic year focused around this year's selection of Enrique's Journey to enrich students.
Discussants: Students from UNIV 103 Telling Your Story.

Film Description: This film is one of Chang's films that address timely issues concerning international adoptees. Sofia is the second of the three children adopted from China by Marilyn and Peter Robinson of Grand Junction, CO. A lead singer of her school choir and an accomplished dancer, Sofia often wonders where her talent comes from. Are her singing and dancing inherited traits? Her lack of knowledge of her birth parents has left her with an emotional void, a "hole in her heart." She has only a few "known" facts the orphanage provided: She was picked up by a company employee on his way to work and her birth parents had left a note. However, once in China, she finds herself struggling with a new identity: There was no such note from her birth parents and her birth date was fabricated for the sake of "quick adoption;" the worker claimed that he and his wife had adopted her, even producing an album with pictures of Sofia in the first six months of her life. Source: www.fccnt.org/chang.html.
Ticket Information: This event is FREE and open to the public.

event.shortdesc: Series 42 Presents Pokey Lafarge and the South City Three. This performance mixes genres of ragtime, jugband, blues, folk and country to create a unique blend of music.

With a jam-packed 2011 performance and recording schedule that will have the South City Three playing through North America and Europe, look for Pokey to continue his rise as a premier tradition bearer, musician, songwriter and entertainer. The concert is sponsored by The Ware Center at Millersville University Lancaster & Rodgers & Associates and co-sponsored by Music for Everyone.
Ticket Information: Tickets are $15 per person, $12 for students with ID.

event.title: Horrocks Lecture: James Buchanan
event.shortdesc: Dr. Thomas Horrocks Presents the lecture "15th US President James Buchanan: The Coming of the Civil War"

fulldesc.p: Description: Thomas A. Horrocks has a scholarly interest in politics in 19th century America with a focus on 19th century presidential campaign biographies. In this lecture he discusses Lancaster-based President James Buchanan and how he handled the growing animosity between the north and the south states on the brink of a Civil War. Horrocks is Associate Librarian for Collections of Harvard's Houghton Library. The Lecture is sponsored by The Ware Center at Millersville University and Rodgers & Associates and co-sponsored by LancasterHistory.org and Ann Barshinger.
Ticket Information: The lecture is free and open to the public.

event.title: University Theatre presents: Teibele and Her Demon
event.shortdesc: Playwrights Singer and Friedman create a dark world of mystery and superstition in this story of love, passion and deception.

fulldesc.p: Description: Millersville University Theatre presents "Teibele and her Demon," a fable by Isaac Bashevis Singer and Eve Friedman, who create a dark world of mystery and superstition in this story of love, passion and deception.

In a Polish-Jewish village in the late 19th century lives Teibele, a young attractive woman whose husband has deserted her and apparently disappeared. Teibele can't remarry until he's legally declared dead. Alchonon, a woebegone, unemployed scholar, loves Teibele from afar, but she despises him. But Alchonon knows of Teibele's fascination for biblical demons and their powers, and devises an outrageous plan to woo and win her in the dark. His plan succeeds; disguised as a demon, he captures the heart of his Teibele, but can he ever win her love in the real world?
The production will run in Rafters Theatre of Dutcher Hall on the following dates and times:
Directed by Tony Elliot and produced by special arrangements with Samuel French, Inc. PG 13 - MATURE THEMES
$10.00 General Admission
$7.00 MU ID, Senior Citizens and Students
$5.00 MU ID super saver advance sales only at the Student Memorial Center (SMC)

It is suggested you purchase your tickets in advance because of the limited seating the Rafters Theatre. Tickets can be purchased Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. - 4 p.m. at the Student Memorial Center (SMC) Ticket Office (Room 103) or by calling the Ticket Office at 717-872-3811 and online at www.MUTicketsOnline.com

event.title: University Theatre presents: Teibele and Her Demon
event.shortdesc: Playwrights Singer and Friedman create a dark world of mystery and superstition in this story of love, passion and deception.

fulldesc.p: Description: Millersville University Theatre presents "Teibele and her Demon," a fable by Isaac Bashevis Singer and Eve Friedman, who create a dark world of mystery and superstition in this story of love, passion and deception.

In a Polish-Jewish village in the late 19th century lives Teibele, a young attractive woman whose husband has deserted her and apparently disappeared. Teibele can't remarry until he's legally declared dead. Alchonon, a woebegone, unemployed scholar, loves Teibele from afar, but she despises him. But Alchonon knows of Teibele's fascination for biblical demons and their powers, and devises an outrageous plan to woo and win her in the dark. His plan succeeds; disguised as a demon, he captures the heart of his Teibele, but can he ever win her love in the real world?
The production will run in Rafters Theatre of Dutcher Hall on the following dates and times:
Directed by Tony Elliot and produced by special arrangements with Samuel French, Inc. PG 13 - MATURE THEMES
$10.00 General Admission
$7.00 MU ID, Senior Citizens and Students
$5.00 MU ID super saver advance sales only at the Student Memorial Center (SMC)

It is suggested you purchase your tickets in advance because of the limited seating the Rafters Theatre. Tickets can be purchased Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. - 4 p.m. at the Student Memorial Center (SMC) Ticket Office (Room 103) or by calling the Ticket Office at 717-872-3811 and online at www.MUTicketsOnline.com

event.title: Dance Arts Series Grand Opening
event.shortdesc: The Dance Series kicks off at The Ware Center with unique dance performances in ballet, contemporary/modern, tap & cultural created by local dance studios and local professional dancers.

fulldesc.p: Description: The opening night is a two part dance presentation. The first act consists of professional level dancers from local dance studios. Participating in the evening are: Cobalt Dance Company, Dance Mosaic, the F&M Dance Program, Lancaster School of Ballet and Vicktor Yeliohin International Ballet Academy. Modern, contemporary and ballet pieces will be performed.

The second act is a performance by Fuego Dance Company, under the direction of Hector Serrano, CEO and founder. The oldest and largest Salsa dance studio in the city of Philadelphia is celebrating its 15th year. Twelve professional dancers and singers will present a variety of Latino and Salsa-inspired dance and vocal works. The program is family-friendly and designed to include audience participation. A highlight of the program is a song by Lisa Diaz, who provides the Spanish voices in Nickelodeon's "Dora the Explorer" TV series recordings. The performance is preceded with a social interchange, including a table top display of regional dance studio owners, dance outfit providers, and others. It is followed by a post-show dessert reception where audience members can meet the performers. Also in the lobby is a special dance costume exhibit, with costumes by Dancer's Edge and Eleanor Isaacson.

Ticket Information:Tickets for adults and parents are $15. Students are free with ID. Advance reservations are strongly encouraged. To reserve your seat please call 717-872-3811. Or you can reserve online at www.MUTicketsOnline.com

event.location: The Ware Center at Millersville University Lancaster

event.title: Biology Colloquium Series: "Tick Ecology and Epizotiology at Letterkenny Army Depot"
event.shortdesc: Dr. Richard Stewart, Shippensburg University, will present as part of the fall 2011 Biology Department Colloquium Series.

fulldesc.p: Description: The Department of Biology at Millersville University presents the fall 2011 Biology Colloquium Series. On October 26, Dr. Richard Stewart, associate professor of biology at Shippensburg University, will present "Tick Ecology and Epizotiology at Letterkenny Army Depot."
All lectures will be given Wednesdays from 4-4:50 p.m. in Caputo Hall Room 210. Light refreshments will be served before the presentation.

The purpose of the Biology Colloquium is to bring outstanding scientists to campus to talk and interact with our students. The biology department strongly believes that these colloquia provide wonderful opportunities and expect that all students who are serious about biology will attend.
Ticket Information: This event is free and open to the public.

event.ticketinfo: This event is free and open to the public.

event.title: Reflect and Connect Series: Enriques Journey
event.shortdesc: One Book, One Campus and Reflect and Connect Series presents a reflection on the book Enrique's Journey

fulldesc.p: Description: The book Enrique's Journey, by author Sonia Nazario, will be examined as part of Millersville University's Reflect and Connect Series on October 26 from 5-6:30 p.m. in the Ford Atrium of McComsey Hall. During the event, reflect on passages of Enrique's Journey with students from Millersville professor of English Dr. Caleb Corkery's classes, pulling out narrative themes from Enrique's experience to understand different cultural perspectives. Also connect with local organizations that serve immigrant communities.

This event is held in conjunction with the University's One Book, One Campus program, which is hosting multiple programs throughout the academic year focused around this year's selection of Enrique's Journey to enrich students.

The Reflect & Connect Series is a series of gatherings where community members including students, faculty and staff, and residents in the larger community, read short pieces of literature on service, reflect on civic engagement and connect with the community.
Ticket Information: This event is FREE and open to the public.

event.ticketinfo: Free and open to the public

event.title: Millersville University Homecoming: Schedule of Events
event.shortdesc: Find out what activities are planned as Millersville University celebrates its 2011 Homecoming weekend
event.fulldesc:
Description: This year, Millersville University will celebrate its homecoming weekend with a number of events from Thursday, October 27 to Saturday, October 29. See the schedule of events below:
*denotes Alumni Association sponsored event
Thursday, October 27, 2011
8 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.
Science and Mathematics Student Research Poster Display, Caputo Hall Lobby. Undergraduate and graduate research projects will be displayed. Free.
7p.m
Distinguished Lecture in Nursing, Lehr Room, Bolger Conference Center, Gordinier Halll. Ann L. O'Sullivan Ph.D, FAAN, CRNP presents: "Are You Ready for the Consensus Model to be Implemented?" This event is sponsored by MU's Department of Nursing and the Xi Chi Chapter of Sigma Theta Tau International, Inc. Join us for a light reception at 6 p.m., followed by the lecture at 7 p.m. Free, but reservations are required for the receptioin.
Friday, October 28, 2011
8 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.
Science and Mathematics Student Research Poster Display, Caputo Hall Lobby. Undergraduate and graduate research projects will be displayed. Free.
10a.m.
*Alumni and Friends Golf Outing, Crossgates Golf Course, Millersville. Open to alumni, faculty, staff and community friends. There will be a shotgun start at 10 a.m. and the format of play will be scramble. Fee includes continental-style breakfast, greens fee, ½ cart, beverage and snack at the turn, catered buffet dinner (at the new clubhouse restaurant) and prizes for closest to the pin, longest drive and straightest drive. Directions to Crossgates Golf Club can be found at www.crossgatesgolf.com. Sponsors: Student Services, Inc., Student Lodging, Inc. & MU Alumni Association. Price: $85/pp. Advance reservations required.
5 p.m.
*Class of 1961 Campus Tours, depart from Student Memorial Center in front of Clock Bell Tower. Free.
6 - 8 p.m.
*Class of 1961 Meet and Mingle, Campus Grill, Bolger Conference Center, Gordinier Hall. Price: $10/pp. Reservations required.
5:30 p.m./6:15 p.m.
*17th Annual Athletic Hall of Fame Reception and Dinner, Lehr Room, Bolger Conference Center, Gordinier Hall. 2011 honorees include Rodney Bimson, athletic trainer; Bill Bowers '69, track and field; Kristy Garner '05, women's basketball; Coleen Seig Mrakovich '86, field hockey; John Petrus '89, football and Gema Robles '03, women's basketball. All alumni and friends are cordially invited to attend. Dinner options: Maryland Crab Cakes or Roast Tenderloin $35; Children (12 and under): $15. Reservations required.
8 p.m.
University Theatre Presents "Teibele and Her Demon," Rafters Theatre, Dutcher Hall - TICKETED. Purchase tickets through MU Ticket Office at 717-872-3811 or online at www.muticketsonline.com.
Saturday, October 29, 2011
7 a.m. - 7 p.m.
The Anchor Cafe and Market, first floor, Gordinier Hall. Come visit a new experience on campus that includes deli foods, salads, soups, snacks, a full line of beverages, bakery specialties, ice cream, coffees, pizza, hot menu selections and convenience store items. Limited table seating available with wireless internet access. Cash only.
8 a.m. - 3 p.m.
*Alumni Hospitality, Student Memorial Center. Take tours of the beautifully renovated Student Memorial Center. Register, win prizes and check out the new Smoothie bar.
8 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.
Science and Mathematics Student Research Poster Display, Caputo Hall Lobby. Undergraduate and graduate research projects will be displayed. Free.
9 - 11:30 a.m.
*Alumni Information Center, Duncan Alumni House. Please use front entrance.
9 a.m. - 3 p.m.
Tours of the new Student Memorial Center, Depart from the Alumni Hospitality tables in the Clock Tower lobby. Free.
9 a.m.
*Millersville Community Parade, "Our American Heritage: Celebrating Millersville's 250th Anniversary." N. George St., Herr Ave., Landis Ave. Be a part of it or watch the award-winning, annual community/University effort as the two-mile parade winds through the borough of Millersville, ending near the Student Memorial Center on James St. Special Toys for Tots Collection at the Judging area and along the parade route. This year's parade is being dedicated to US Marine Cpl. Eric Torbert, Jr., a Penn Manor alumnus, who was killed in Afghanistan in December 2010. Free.
10 a.m. - 1 p.m.
Athletic Department Chicken Barbeque/Pick-up, Creek Drive Parking Lot. Enjoy a freshly prepared chicken BBQ lunch. Proceeds benefit Marauder Athletics. Preordering is suggested and guarantees meal availability. Dinner includes half chicken, chips, applesauce, dessert & beverage. FOOD PICK-UP NOTE: Expect traffic delays due to Millersville Parade (9 a.m. - noon); COST: $8, $5 for half-chicken. DEADLINE TO ORDER TICKETS IS FRIDAY, OCTOBER 15. To order, please contact Donna at 717-872-3405 or email deshleman@millersville.edu
11 a.m. - 2 p.m.
Class of 1961 Tour of Downtown Lancaster Central Market, Millersville University Lancaster, Lancaster County Convention Center and Thaddeus Stevens House. Meet at 10:45 a.m. in the lobby of the Marriott Hotel on the corner of King and Queen streets. Price: Free, but reservations required.
11 a.m. - 3 p.m.
*Fall Fling Family Fun, Student Memorial Center, Rec Center. Kids Entertainment Stage, Kid friendly fun: Games, animals, music and more. Free. noon
*Wrestling Reunion and Picnic, Tent at Biemesderfer Stadium. Note: Price includes ticket to the football game. For details, contact Todd Roberts at 717-872-3795 or todd.roberts@millersville.edu by Oct. 15. Price: $20/pp; $15 for students with MU ID. Reservations required.
noon
School of Education Alumni Gathering, Student Memorial Center. School of Education alumni are invited for light refreshments. Reservations are requested by registering online at www.villealumni.com or calling the Alumni Office at 717-872-3352/800-681-1855. For more info, contact the Dean's Office, Education at 717-872-3379. Admission is free. Reservations are requested.
noon
School of Science & Mathematics Alumni Gathering,Student Memorial Center. School of Science and Math alumni are invited for dessert and beverages by registering online at www.villealumni.com or call the Alumni Office at 717-872-3352/800-681-1855. For more info, contact the Dean's Office, School of Science and Mathematics at 717-872-3407. Admission isFree. Reservations are requested.
noon
School of Humanities and Social Sciences Alumni Gathering,Student Memorial Center. School of Humanities and Social Sciences alumni are invited for light refreshments. Reservations are requested by registering online at www.villealumni.com or calling the Alumni Services Office at 717-872-3352/800-681-1855. Admission is free. Reservations requested.
noon - 3 p.m.
Millersville Pictorial Postmark, Student Memorial Center, Main Lobby. The US Postal Service will be on hand to officially postmark any paper item with the Millersville 250th Anniversary pictorial postmark (the official logo of their special anniversary year). 2011 is the anniversary of the original land signing between John Miller and a local Indian tribe who originally owned the acres now known as Millersville. Collect this historical item. Free.
noon - 5 p.m.
*Marauders Cove Alumni Hospitality, Biemesderfer Stadium Alumni Tent (East Gate Entrance area). Alumni please register and pick up free MU items and reunion souvenirs. Kids activities, snacks and more! Alumni will have a chance to spin the prize wheel. Stop by - limited prizes available. Come over to the hospitality tent any time during the game! Something for everyone! Free.
12:30 - 2 p.m.
"Author, Author!!" Student Memorial Center, Rec Center. Calling all alumni, faculty, staff and MU Retiree authors. You are invited to feature, sell and autograph books you have authored to Homecoming visitors. If you would like to be showcased and have a table for your book(s), please register online at www.villealumni.com.
Pre-game
MU Athletic Hall of Fame Recognition, Biemesderfer Stadium (50-yard line). 2011 Inductees will be recognized on the field. Come out and cheer on our special honorees.
1:30 p.m.
Marauder Football vs. Shippensburg. Biemesderfer Stadium, Chryst Field. Marauder fans of all ages are welcome to attend this game! Activities include presentation of the 2011 Athletic Hall of Fame recipients and the Alumni Association's Distinguished Alumni Award recipient, R. William Field ‘77/ M'85. Tickets are required. See reservation form or go online (www.villealumni.com) for ticket purchases in advance.
Halftime
2011 Charity King & Queen Crowning/MU Marching Band Program, Biemesderfer Stadium.
3:30 p.m.
5th Quarter Chili Fest. Refreshments and Entertainment, Alumni Marauders Cove Tent, Biemesderfer Stadium. 2001, 1991, 1981 alumni are welcome to gather and celebrate your 10th, 20th and 30th class reunions. Price: Free. Registration/reservation required.
3:30 p.m.
Sigma Tau Gamma Alumni Gathering, Campus Grill, Gordinier Hall. Price: $18.95/pp and $12 for those age 21 and younger. Registration/reservation required.
5:30 p.m.
*Class of 1956 55th Anniversary Reunion, Reception, Class Photo and Luncheon, Audubon Room, Gordinier Hall. All members of the 1956 class are invited back to campus for a luncheon before the football game. Price: $15/pp. Reservations required.
5:30 p.m./ 6:30 p.m.
*Class of 1961 50th Anniversary Reunion: Reception, Class Photo and Dinner, Gordinier Hall. All members of the 1961 class are invited back to campus for a reception and dinner. Price: $40/pp. Registration/reservation required. 8 p.m.
University Theatre Presents "Teibele and Her Demon," Rafters Theatre, Dutcher Hall - TICKETED. Purchase tickets through MU Ticket Office at 717-872-3811 or online at www.muticketsonline.com. For questions: The Alumni Services Office phone numbers are 717-872-3352 and 800-681-1855 (toll-free); Fax: 717-871-5050; email: mualumni@millersville.edu. Please visit our alumni homepage at www.villealumni.com and register for Homecoming.

On most Thursdays there will be a mathematics colloquium talk either at Millersville University or at Franklin & Marshall College. These colloquium talks may be by visiting speakers or MU/F&M faculty or students.

event.shortdesc: All alumni and friends are cordially invited to attend the 17th Annual Athletic Hall of Fame Reception and Dinner.

fulldesc.p: Description: Millersville University welcomes alumni and friends to attend the 17th Annual Athletic Hall of Fame reception and dinner to honor the 2011 inductees, on October 28 at 5:30 p.m. This event, which is held in conjunction with the University's homecoming celebration, will take place in Lehr Room, Bolger Conference Center, Gordinier Hall.

This year's inductees include J. Rodney Bimson, athletic trainer; Bill Bowers '69, track and field; Kristy Garner '06, women's basketball; Coleen Seig Mrakovich '86, field hockey; John Petrus '89, football and Gema Robles '03, women's basketball. For detailed biographies on the 2011 Athletic Hall of Fame honorees, please visit the athletics website at www.millersvilleathletics.com.

The purpose of the Millersville University Athletic Hall of Fame is to honor and perpetuate the memory of those individuals who, through participation, support or interest, have made outstanding contributions to Millersville University athletics, and who have helped bring recognition, honor, distinction or excellence to Millersville University and its intercollegiate athletics program.

event.title: Homecoming Event: Millersville's Community Parade
event.shortdesc: Celebrate Millersville University's Homecoming weekend at the Millersville Community Parade

fulldesc.p: Description: During Millersville University's Homecoming celebration, the Millersville Community Parade will be held on Saturday, October 29. This year's theme is Our American Heritage: Celebrating Millersville's 250th Anniversary.

Beginning at 9 a.m., this three-hour, award-winning parade attracts more than 6,000 spectators along a two-mile route through the borough of Millersville ending near the Student Memorial Center on James St., with 2,300 participants. Entries include 20 varied music groups (i.e., University and high school bands, drum and bugle corps, bagpipers, U.S. Armed Forces bands, a steel drum band, Philadelphia Mummers band), floats, impersonators, mascots, fire and emergency groups, twirlers, live animals, antique vehicles and more. The Millersville Community Parade is one of Lancaster County's largest parades!

The 2011 parade will be dedicated to local U.S. Marine Cpl., Eric Torbert, Jr., a Penn Manor alumnus, who was killed in Afghanistan in December 2010. Also, the parade committee is working with the Toys for Tots Program to collect toys from parade spectators on parade day.
Parade Grand Marshal: Phil and Mary Ann Gerber
For more information, check out the parade website: www.parade.millersville.edu/.
Parade Route: Herr Ave/Landis Ave/George St.

NOTE: North George Street, Herr Avenue and Landis Avenue will close at 8:45 a.m. for the parade; alternate routes will be posted on October 29. Parade will run approximately 2 ½ hours. Please allow ample time to reach your destination.
Ticket Information: This event is free and open to the public.

event.ticketinfo: Free and open to the public

event.title: Day of African Events
event.shortdesc: Millersville University's Department of Music African Dance Symposium presents: A Day of African Events.

fulldesc.p: Description: On October 29, Millersville University's music department is presenting "A Day of African Drumming, Dance and Performance," featuring Baile's African Drum Works Ensemble.

The day includes a drumming workshop, a dance workshop and culminates with an energetic performance of traditional African music, dance, drama and folklore with drummers, dancers, singing, masquerades and lots of energy. All the events will be located within the Millersville University Lancaster location downtown.
The drumming workshop is from 10:30 a.m. - noon; the dance workshop is from 1 - 2:45 p.m. and the performance by Baile's African Drumworks Ensemble begins at 7 p.m.
Student Admission: $5 for one event, $7 for two events, $10 for three events.
Adult Admission: $15 for one event, $20 for two events, $25 for three events

Tickets may be purchased online, at www.MUTicketsOnline.com, in the Student Memorial Center Ticket Office (Room 103), by calling the Ticket Office at 717-872-3811, or at Millersville University Lancaster, 42 N. Prince St., Lancaster. Ticket offices are open Monday - Friday, 8 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.

event.location: The Ware Center at Millersville University Lancaster, 42 N. Prince St., Lancaster

event.title: University Theatre presents: Teibele and Her Demon
event.shortdesc: Playwrights Singer and Friedman create a dark world of mystery and superstition in this story of love, passion and deception.

strong.span: OCTOBER 29 performance has been CANCELED due to the weather.

fulldesc.p: Description: Millersville University Theatre presents "Teibele and her Demon," a fable by Isaac Bashevis Singer and Eve Friedman, who create a dark world of mystery and superstition in this story of love, passion and deception.

In a Polish-Jewish village in the late 19th century lives Teibele, a young attractive woman whose husband has deserted her and apparently disappeared. Teibele can't remarry until he's legally declared dead. Alchonon, a woebegone, unemployed scholar, loves Teibele from afar, but she despises him. But Alchonon knows of Teibele's fascination for biblical demons and their powers, and devises an outrageous plan to woo and win her in the dark. His plan succeeds; disguised as a demon, he captures the heart of his Teibele, but can he ever win her love in the real world?
The production will run in Rafters Theatre of Dutcher Hall on the following dates and times:
Directed by Tony Elliot and produced by special arrangements with Samuel French, Inc. PG 13 - MATURE THEMES
$10.00 General Admission
$7.00 MU ID, Senior Citizens and Students
$5.00 MU ID super saver advance sales only at the Student Memorial Center (SMC)

It is suggested you purchase your tickets in advance because of the limited seating the Rafters Theatre. Tickets can be purchased Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. - 4 p.m. at the Student Memorial Center (SMC) Ticket Office (Room 103) or by calling the Ticket Office at 717-872-3811 and online at www.MUTicketsOnline.com

event.ticketinfo: $10.00 General Admission $7.00 MU ID, Senior Citizens and Students **$5.00 MU ID super saver advance sales only at the Student Memorial Center

event.title: Fall Percussion Extravaganza
event.shortdesc: Millersville University's Department of Music Percussion Symposium presents the Fall Percussion Extravaganza.

fulldesc.p: Description: Millersville University welcomes Brazilian solo marimba artist Gilmar Goulart in his first Pennsylvania appearance. Goulart will be joined by acclaimed Overdekte Brug PercussieTrio and the Millersville University Percussion Ensemble. A wide variety of percussion music will be presented in solo and ensemble form in this special event.

Gilmar Goulart Biography: Goulart is head of the Percussion Department Studies at the Federal University of Santa Maria, Brazil. He finished his DMA in 2001 at the University of Colorado at Boulder, with Douglas Walter; studied with Ian Wright at the Royal Northern College of Music, Manchester, England; and Ney Rosauro in Santa Maria. At the RNCM he became the first marimbist to be awarded the Professional Performance Diploma with Distinction. He also presented the British premiere of David Maslanka;"Concerto for Marimba and Winds, with the RNCM Wind Orchestra. Goulart has recorded two CDs:"The World of Marimba, (1998), and "The Moods of Marimba (2006). He has presented many Brazilian premieres of important composers for percussion such as Christopher Deane, Eric Ewazen, James Ure, David Jones. He has also commissioned works for solo marimba from composers in Brazil, USA, and Europe. As a clinician, he has taught courses and seminar s in Brazil and Argentina and the U.S.

Overdekte Brug Percussietrio Biography: Covering a multitude of percussion styles that bridge all extremes of emotion and musical possibility, Overdekte Brug Percussietrio creates a unique niche in the evolving world of percussion performance. Featuring the talents of Dr. Daniel Heslink, James Armstrong, and Steve Goss this Central Pennsylvania based ensemble shows no remorse when pushing the boundaries of musical expression and creativity. From the avant-garde to the traditional, from Cage to Corea, the excitement that Overdekte Brug Percussietrio brings to each performance is certainly memorable and unprecedented.

Millersville University Percussion Ensemble Bio: Under the direction of James Armstrong, 20 members strong, the Percussion and Mallet Ensembles are comprised of the percussion majors and minors in the Millersville University music department. The members find percussion and mallet ensembles to serve as an important part of their training, and are dedicated to the furtherance of percussion ensemble music as one of America's most exciting art forms. The ensemble is support by MU's significant collection of fine percussion instruments and outstanding ensemble library. Both the Mallet and Percussion Ensembles have performed extensively on tours, at the East Coast Percussion Ensemble Festival, at Percussive Arts Society events and children's concerts. In existence for more than 30 years, these ensembles are credited with the premiers of many new works and arrangements for the medium.

Ticket Information: Tickets are $10 general admission and FREE for students with ID. event.title: National Disability Employment Awareness Month Program
event.shortdesc: National Disability Employment Awareness Month Program will use lecture, discussion and case studies to guide participants through disability etiquette and awareness issues from a social justice perspective.

fulldesc.p: Description: Almost half of all complaints of harassment in the workplace are on the part of people with disabilities. It most often occurs as a result of inexperience or a general lack of comfort and confidence in knowing the "right thing" to do and/or say. This session will highlight specific examples that will resonate with everyone's experiences.Using lecture, discussion and case studies, participants will be guidedthrough disability etiquette and awareness issues from a social justice perspective. Examples of the do's and don'ts of actions, language, etc. will be reviewed on a disability specific basis.
Disability Etiquette & Awareness Sessions run:
4 - 5:30 p.m. (Repeated)
Sponsored by: ADA Committee Office of Housing & Residential Programs, Office of Human Resources, Office of Social Equity & Diversity and Office of the Vice President for Finance & Administration
Ticket Information: This event is free and open to the public.

event.title: Halloween Horror Movie The Creek
event.shortdesc: Horror film "The Creek" -- written, directed & produced by Erik Soulliard is the perfect way to spend Halloween! Director Erik Soulliard will be on hand for the evening.

fulldesc.p: Description: Come celebrate Halloween-if you come in costume you are eligible to win a prize. "The Creek" by Erik Soulliard, who will be on hand for the evening, has won numerous horror film awards including "Best Horror Feature" at the Illinois International Film Festival. On the fifth anniversary of the death of their friend Billy, six friends are forced back together by his ghost. Billy's death was officially considered an accident, but old suspicions and conflicts return. When people start dying they all must ask themselves if it's his ghost, one of them, or because they returned to the Creek? The film is sponsored by The Ware Center at Millersville University & Rodgers & Associates.
Ticket Information: Tickets are $5 per person, Students are free with ID.

event.title: Public Hearing: Senate Appropriations Committee
event.shortdesc: Millersville University will host the Senate Appropriations Committee 1 - 4 for a public hearing on campus.

fulldesc.p: Description: NOVEMBER 3: Millersville University will host the Senate Appropriations Committee for a public hearing on campus. Students, faculty and staff are invited to hear testimony on a package of bipartisan bills intended to modernize and update the statute governing the Pennsylvania State System of Higher Education.
The public hearing will take place on Thursday, November 3, from 1-4 p.m. in Reighard Multipurpose Room, located in the Student Memorial Center.
Students, faculty and staff are invited to observe and hear presentations and testimony about public higher education in Pennsylvania.

p.strong: Location: Reighard Multipurpose Room, Student Memorial Center

ul.li: I. Introductory remarks by Guido M. Pichini, chair of the Board of Governors of PASSHE, and Drs. Francine G. McNairy, president of Millersville University and William Ruud, president of Shippensburg University and the Commission of University Presidents.
II. How PASSHE Relates to the Commonwealth, its Regions and its Communities.
IV. The Academic Experience (students and faculty).
VI. Wrap-Up - Chancellor Dr. John Cavanaugh.

event.title: 27th Brossman Science Lecture: Dr. Edith Widder
event.shortdesc: Brossman Science Lecture, sponsored by The Mr. and Mrs. William F. Brossman Charitable Foundation, invites Dr. Edith Widder, biologist and deep-sea explorer.

fulldesc.p: Description: Dr. Edith Widder, biologist and deep-sea explorer, will present the 27th Brossman Science Lecture, on November 3 at 7 p.m. She will present on the topic, "Exploring and Protecting Planet Ocean."This event, which is sponsored by The Mr. and Mrs. William F. Brossman Charitable Foundation, will be held in Marauder Court of the Student Memorial Center.

Widder's presentation will answer the following questions: What beauty can be found at the ocean's greatest depths? And how can we protect it? Her presentation will give a breathtaking view of the world beneath the surface of the seas.

Biography: Widder is an expert in oceanographic research and a leader in designing and inventing new submersible equipment to enable unobtrusive deep-sea observations. Widder is co-founder of the Ocean Research & Conservation Association (ORCA), a nonprofit organization dedicated to the protection and restoration of marine ecosystems and involved in helping with the Gulf Oil Spill. She combines her expertise in research and technological innovation with a commitment to reversing the worldwide trend of degradation in our marine environment.
Ticket Information: This event is free and open to the public.

fulldesc.p: The true story of a Bohemian St. Francis and his remarkable relationship with a flock of wild red-and-green parrots. Mark Bittner, a dharma bum, former street musician in San Francisco, falls in with the flock as he searches for meaning in his life, unaware that the wild parrots will bring him everything he needs.

event.title: Ernesto Tamayo in Concert
event.shortdesc: Ernesto Tamayo, an accomplished guitarist, gives a concert at Millersville University Lancaster

fulldesc.p: Description: Ernesto Tamayo will be performing in a concert on November 3 at 7:30 p.m., at Millersville University Lancaster.

Biography: Ernesto Tamayo has toured extensively throughout North and South America, Asia and Europe. He is one of the most accomplished and sought-after guitarists of his generation. Born in Havana, Cuba, musical prodigy Ernesto Tamayo began studying the guitar with his father when he was five. He made his public performance and television debut at the young age of nine. In 1995, Sony Music Entertainment and Sony Classical enabled Ernesto to come to the United States. He received a full scholarship for advanced studies at The Peabody Conservatory. In September of 1999, he made his Carnegie Hall debut with a sold-out performance. Ernesto has completed his 6th CD where he features his compositions for guitar and orchestra. During the past few concert seasons he has performed nearly 80 concerts per season worldwide making him one of the most demanded young classical guitarists of our time. The evening is a fundraiser in support of Millersville University Lancaster's Visiting Artists program.

event.title: Guest Artist Master Class: Barber String Quartet
event.shortdesc: The Millersville University Department of Music String Symposium presents a Master Class by the Barber String Quartet.

fulldesc.p: Description: The Millersville University Department of Music String Symposium presents a master class by guest artist the Barber String Quartet. The master class event will begin at 3:30 p.m. at Millersville University Lancaster.
Following the master class, at 7:30 p.m., the Barber String Quartet will perform a concert.

Biography: The Barber String Quartet stemmed from an idea of creating a unique chamber group based on the concepts of long-gone or slowly disappearing string quartets that had a distinct personality and the particular "sound" each was associated with. The idea came to life at the dawn of 2010, when a group of young musicians embarked upon the search of that distinct individuality that would set them apart from everyone else. After "finding" a perfect balance and in a constant pursue of perfection, the Barber String Quartet was born.
Band members include Vladimer Dyo, violin; Aisha Dossumova, violin; Dennis Krasnokutsky, viola and Rajli Bicolli, cello.
Ticket Information: The master class event is free and open to the public.

Tickets are required for the 7:30 p.m. recital. Tickets cost $15 for general admission, 5$ for students with ID. event.title: Military Appreciation Day
event.shortdesc: A Military Appreciation Day will be held on Saturday, November 5, during the home football game against the West Chester Rams. Millersville athletics T-shirts will be sold to raise money for the Wounded Warrior Project!

fulldesc.p: Description: To show appreciation to local veterans, Millersville University's athletics department and ROTC have teamed up to host a Military Appreciation Day on Saturday, November 5, during the home football game, where the Millersville Marauders will take on West Chester Rams at Biemesderfer Stadium, Chryst Field.

Two Millersville athletics t-shirts will be sold during the game. One shirt is black and features the Millersville athletics "M" logo in camouflage; the second shirt is camouflage with a black Millersville athletics "M" logo. All proceeds from the t-shirt sales will benefit the Wounded Warrior Project (WWP), an organization that raises awareness and enlists the public's aid for the needs of injured service members.

The black Millersville athletics t-shirts will be sold for $10; the camouflage t-shirt will be sold for $15. For more information, contact Steve Roach, associate athletic director, at Steve.Roach@millersville.edu or 717-871-7210, or contact CPT Joe Ocheskey, ROTC, at Joe.Ocheskey@millersville.edu.
Ticket Information: Veterans with a military ID will be provided with free admission to the game.

event.title: Performance: BREAK! The Urban Funk Spectacular - A Steve Love Production
event.shortdesc: BREAK! The Urban Funk Spectacular traces the history of hip-hop dancing over the last 30 years

fulldesc.p: Description: BREAK! The Urban Funk Spectacular, a Steve Love Production, traces the history of hip-hop dancing over the last 30 years. This performance will take place on November 5 at 7 p.m. in the Reighard Multipurpose Room in the Student Memorial Center.

Biography: BREAK! The Urban Funk Spectacular is a tribute to this American urban art form. Cast members are supremely talented artists from the world of "Break dancing," "Locking," "Electric Boogaloo" or "Popping," Power Tumbling, as well as DJ-ing and Bucket Drumming. Many have been featured soloists in performances with show-business legends as Madonna, Janet Jackson, B2K, 50 Cent, Ringo Star, Whitney Houston, Puff Daddy and Luther Vandross. A distinctive American art form with hazy African roots that run deep through the streets of inner cities, hip hop defies easy definition. Comprised of five elements - Dance, MC (or "rap"), DJ, Graffiti and Fashion - each component is improvised and recombined in a myriad of rhythms and styles so that hip hop reinvents itself continually. www.breakshow.com

event.title: "The Fire Still Burns: Religion and Censorship in LGBTQ Art"
event.shortdesc: "The Fire Still Burns: Art and Censorship in LGBTQ Art"

fulldesc.p: Description: Millersville University faculty member, Dr. Christine Filippone, art and design professor, recently organized and invited Millersville faculty to join a panel titled, The Fire Still Burns: Religion and Censorship in LGBTQ Art. The Fire Still Burns: Religion and Censorship in LGBTQ Art features Dr. Jonathan Katz and Nancy J. Knauer, I. Herman Stern professor of law at Temple University Beasley School of Law at 7:30 p.m. November 9, Steinman Hall, The Ware Center at Millersville University.

The panel is open to students, faculty and staff as well as the broader Millersville, Lancaster and PA communities. The panel will focus on the content and subsequent censorship of the first ever major U.S. museum exhibition examining expressions of LGBTQ sexual identity and desire entitled, Hide/Seek: Difference and Desire in American Portraiture, held at the National Portrait Gallery in fall 2010.
Ticket Information: Free and open to the public

event.title: Humanities Film Series presents: Daughter from Danang
event.shortdesc: One Book, One Campus and Humanities Film Series presents Daughter from Danang

fulldesc.p: Description: The Humanities Film Series presents a screening of the film Daughter from Danang, by Gail Dolgin and Vicente Franco, on November 10 at 7 p.m. in Myers Auditorium of McComsey Hall. This event is held in conjunction with the University's One Book, One Campus program, which is hosting multiple programs throughout the academic year focused around this year's selection of Enrique's Journey to enrich students.
Discussants: Dr. Caleb Corkery, associate professor of English at Millersville University's students from his freshman seminar course, "Telling Your Story."

Film Description: A heartbreaking documentary that upsets your expectations of happily-ever-afters, Daughter from Danang is a riveting emotional drama of longing, identity and the personal legacy of war. To all outward appearances, Heidi is the proverbial "all-American girl," hailing from small town Pulaski, Tenn. But her birth name was Mai Thi Hiep. Born in Danang, Vietnam in 1968, she's the mixed-race daughter of an American serviceman and a Vietnamese woman. Fearing for her daughter's safety at the war's end, Hiep's mother sent her to the U.S. on "Operation Babylift," a Ford administration plan to relocate orphans and mixed-race children to the U.S. for adoption before they fell victim to a frighteningly uncertain future in Vietnam after the Americans pulled out. Source: www.daughterfromdanang.com/about/.
Ticket Information: This event is FREE and open to the public

event.title: Literary Guild: Howard Means
event.shortdesc: Howard Means will discuss his most recent book, "Johnny Appleseed", including the writers research on John Chapman.

fulldesc.p: Description: Howard Means will discuss his most recent book, "Johnny Appleseed." The lecture will cover the writers reseach on John Chapman, the historic figure that was known as Johnny Appleseed and the evolution from John Chapman to the mutic figure of Johnny Appleseed during his lifetime. The book has been nominated for a National Book Award (non-fiction) and a Pulitzer Prize (biography). The book is also in the process of being optioned for a possible film or documentary.

Added bonus: Artist Judy Beck Lobos will create - specifically for this evening - a twig sculpture in honor of Appleseed. Event is sponsored by The Ware Center at Millersville University Lancaster & Rodgers & Associates; co-sponsored by The Literary Guild & Ann Barshinger.
Ticket Information: Tickets cost $15 and can be purchased online at www.MUTicketsOnline.com

event.title: "Uncharitable" Change Conversation
event.shortdesc: Join Dan Pallotta, author of "Uncharitable," social entrepreneur, provocateur and a leading voice for change as he challenges us to think bigger about the future of Lancaster.

fulldesc.p: Description: Join Dan Pallotta, author of "Uncharitable," social entrepreneur, provocateur and a leading voice for change as he challenges us to think bigger about the future of Lancaster. Presented by the Ah-Ha Collaborative: Lancaster County Community Foundation, The Lancaster Chamber of Commerce & Industry and Millersville University.

Biography: Dan Pallotta founded Pallotta Team-Works, the company that developed AIDS Rides and Breast Cancer three-day events. The company has more than 350 full-time employees in sixteen US offices and was the subject of a Harvard Business School case study on special event fundraising in America. In his book "Uncharitable," and in spite of his success, he begins to challenge the very idea of fundraising and how we can think differently about ways to change the world.
Ticket Information: Tickets cost $15 per person.

event.title: Artist Talk: Barbara Madsen - "Noise Machine" Installation Exhibit
event.shortdesc: Barbara Madsen, artist of the new installation "Noise Machine," will present a Gallery talk on Monday, November 14 at noon - at MU.

fulldesc.p: Description: Artist Barbara Madsen, whose installation exhibit Noise Machine is currently on display in Sykes Gallery, will present a Gallery talk on Monday, November 14 at noon.

Noise Machine, a collaboration between Madsen, Ely Rosa Zamora and A.P. Vague, is a city of objects that alludes to a world gone awry with voracious desire and paranoia. The re-combination ready-mades are of 20th and 21st century detritus from the analog and digital eras.

Madsen Biography: Madsen is known for her works in photography, sculpture, installation and print. Her vast collections of cast off 20th century industrial matter - spark plugs, machine parts, welding masks, light switches, rubber, plastic, prosthetics, artificial eyes, and much more - serve as a means for metaphorical depictions of a voracious world gone awry. She has exhibited in more than 100 group exhibitions in the United States.
Ticket Information: This event is free and open to the public.
Gallery Hours: Monday through Friday, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m., and Sunday, 12-4 p.m., and by appointment.

event.title: Humanities Film Series presents: Game Over
event.shortdesc: The Humanities Film Series presents a screening of the film Game Over: Gender, Race and Violence in Video games on November 17 at 7 p.m. in Myers Auditorium, McComsey Hall.

fulldesc.p: Description: The Humanities Film Series presents a screening of the film, "Game Over: Gender, Race and Violence in Video Games" on November 17 at 7 p.m. in Myers Auditorium, McComsey Hall.

Film Description: Video and computer games represent a $6 billion a year industry. One out of every ten households in American owns a Sony Playstation. Children who own video game equipment play an average of ten hours per week. And yet, despite capturing the attention of millions of children worldwide, video games remain one of the least scrutinized cultural industries. Game Over is the first educational documentary to address the fastest growing segment of the media through engaging questions of gender, race and violence. Source: www.mediaed.org/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=205
Ticket information: This event is free and open to the public.

event.title: Public Lecture: Bobby GonzÃ¡lez - "Why are we not 'Spanish': The Rich Cultural Diversity of Latinos"
event.shortdesc: A public lecture by nationally known multicultural motivational speaker Bobby GonzÃ¡lez

fulldesc.p: Description: The Society on Latino Affairs welcomes Bobby González, a nationally known multicultural motivational speaker, storyteller and poet, for a public lecture, on Thursday, November 17 at 7:30 p.m. Gonzálezs' lecture, titled "Why are we not 'Spanish': The Rich Cultural Diversity of Latinos," will be held in the Reighard Multipurpose Room in the Student Memorial Center.

Biography: González grew up in a bicultural environment. He draws on his Native American (Taino) and Latino (Puerto Rican) roots to offer a unique repertoire of discourses, readings and performances that celebrates his indigenous heritage.

As a storyteller, González has had the privilege of performing at Carnegie Hall, the Museum of Television & Radio and the Detroit Institute of Arts. He has given poetry readings at the National Museum of the American Indian, the University of North Dakota and the Nuyorican Poets Café. González seeks to empower his audiences by encouraging them to embrace their heritage and use this knowledge to create a dynamic future. As an individual proud of his Native American, Latino and African ancestry, González is a messenger of hope, pride and love of diversity.
Ticket Information: This event is free and open to the public.

event.title: Foreign Film Screening
event.shortdesc: Millersville University Library will present two award winning foreign films at its foreign film screening

fulldesc.p: Description: Millersville University Library will present two award winning foreign films at its foreign film screening. Nurse.Fighter.Boy will be presented at 7 p.m. and Alamar will be presented at 9 p.m. The foreign film screenings are co-sponsored by MU's Foreign Language Department and the MU Cine Club.

Nurse.Fighter.Boy: Jude is a single mother who descends from a long line of Jamaican caregivers. Silence is a "past his prime" boxer who fights illegally to survive. Ciel is a boy who delves into music, conjuring dreams for his mother. During the last week of summer, a late night brawl finds the fighter in the nurse's care causing their three fates to be forever entwined. WINNER Best Original Song Genie Awards (Canadian Oscars); Audience Award, Mannheim-Heidelberg International Film Festival.

Alamar: Jorge has only a few weeks with his five-year-old son, Natan, before he leaves to live with his mother in Rome. Intent on teaching Natan about their Mayan heritage, Jorge takes him to the pristine Chinchorro reef and eases Natan into the rhythms of a fisherman's life. As the bond between father and son grows stronger, Natan learns to live in harmony with life above and below the surface of the sea. WINNER Tiger Award, Rotterdam International Film Festival; Audience Award, Morelia International Film Festival; Feature Film Competition Award, Morelia International Film Festival; Jury Award, Iberoamerican Prize, Miami International Film Festival; New Director Award, San Francisco International Film Festival.
Ticket Information: This event is FREE and open to the public.

event.title: Film Screening: American Teacher
event.shortdesc: Millersville University is hosting a community screening of a new documentary film about teachers, "American Teacher," followed by a panel discussion.

fulldesc.p: Description: Millersville University is hosting a community screening of a new documentary film about teachers, "American Teacher" at The Ware Center, Millersville University Lancaster, on November 22 at 4 p.m. There will be a panel discussion with teachers, administrators and students after the film, and hopefully inspire some action on behalf of teachers to advocate for their profession.

Film Synopsis: Weaving interviews of policy experts and startling facts with the lives and careers of four teachers, our film, "American Teacher," tells the collective story by and about those closest to the issues in our educational system-the 3.2 million teachers who spend every day in classrooms across the country. Through an interactive and evolving website and a feature-length documentary that brings together educational experts, student interviews, and a year of documenting the day-to-day lives and sacrifices of public school teachers, THE TEACHER SALARY PROJECT will bring an awareness to the real and imminent crisis in our educational system-how little we value our strongest, most committed, and most effective teachers, and the ripple effect this has on how our children learn and their potential for future success. (information from theteachersalaryproject.org)
Ticket Information: This event is free and open to the public.

event.location: The Ware Center, Millersville University Lancaster, 42 N. Prince St., Lancaster

event.title: First Friday Holiday Celebration at the Ware Center
event.shortdesc: First Friday at The Ware Center will include caroling by the Millersville University student cast of Glorious Sounds of the Season and the Artwork of Robert E. Allen in the Lyet Lobby.

fulldesc.p: Description: First Friday holiday celebration at the Ware Center will include Robert C. Allen, guest artist for the month of December and the Millersville University music department cast of Glorious Sounds of the Season.

Classical craftmanship and innovative design characterize the works of sculptor Robert C. Allen. Allen works primarily with bronze & ferrous metals in the classic techniques of lost wax, sand casting and fabrication. International commissions of his work are displayed in corporate headquarters and university campuses. His latest collection includes one-of-a-kind sculptural clocks which he describes as "medieval futuristic."
The Glorious Sounds of the Season ticketed performance on Friday, December 2 at 7:30 p.m. still has available seats for sale at $15 per person. Don't miss this family holiday tradition!
Ticket Information: Free and open to the public.

event.location: The Ware Center Millersville University Lancaster

event.title: University Theatre presents: The Taming of the Shrew
event.shortdesc: Millersville University Theatre Presents: The Taming of the Shrew

fulldesc.p: The Taming of the Shrew, Shakespeare’s uproarious and unsettling comedy.

p.span: Baptista, a wealthy domineering father of two daughters, proclaims that his youngest and most desirable daughter, Bianca, may not be married until he “rids his hands” of his eldest daughter, Katharina – a notorious shrew. Bianca’s suitors are distraught realizing that no one but a fool will marry Kate. In walks Petruchio, far from foolish and flush with ego; seeing the prospects of a wealthy match for himself, he sets about to tame Kate into a “conforming wife”.
However things are not what they appear to be in Padua, Italy- neither are the people. Only one thing is sure – Love will bloom among the most unlikely of characters.

fulldesc.p: A University Theatre Production
Rafters Theatre, Dutcher Hall, Millersville University
Guest Director:Laura Howell
$10.00 General Admission
$7.00 MU ID, Senior Citizens and Students
$5.00 MU ID super saver advance sales, only at the Student Memorial Center (SMC)

event.title: Celebrate Kwanzaa
event.shortdesc: "Celebrate Kwanzaa" A traditional African American holiday of heritage and culture

fulldesc.p: Description: The celebration will include African Dance, a traditional Kwanzaa ceremony and explanation of the history and symbols of Kwanzaa followed by an African feast.
Ticket Information: This event is FREE and open to the public.

event.location: Reighard Multipurpose Room, Student Memorial Center

event.title: Biology Colloquium Series: "Horticultural Research, A Public Garden Perspective"
event.shortdesc: Dr. Brian Trader, Longwood Gardens Inc., will present as part of the fall 2011 Biology Department Colloquium Series.

fulldesc.p: Description: The Department of Biology at Millersville University presents the fall 2011 Biology Colloquium Series. On December 7, Dr. Brian Trader, domestic and international studies coordinator at Longwood Gardens Inc., in Kennett Square, Pa., will present "Horticultural Research, A Public Garden Perspective."
All lectures will be given Wednesdays from 4-4:50 p.m. in Caputo Hall Room 210. Light refreshments will be served before the presentation.

The purpose of the Biology Colloquium is to bring outstanding scientists to campus to talk and interact with our students. The biology department strongly believes that these colloquia provide wonderful opportunities and expect that all students who are serious about biology will attend.
Ticket Information: This event is free and open to the public.

event.ticketinfo: This event is free and open to the public.

event.title: Lancaster Symphony Brass Quintet
event.shortdesc: Lancaster Symphony Orchestra Presents "Celebrate the Holidays Around the Globe" with the Lancaster Symphony Brass Quintet

fulldesc.p: Description: The Lancaster Symphony Orchestra is proud to celebrate the spirit of Christmas and Hanukkah with a wonderful assortment of holiday favorites, composed by Classical masters from many countries. The Quintet will perform familiar selections from Tchaikovsky's Nutcracker, Handel's Aria and Joy to the World, and Mendelssohn's Joy to the World, along with modern classics such as Jingle Bell Rock, Winter Wonderland and many other favorite classic carols for brass.
Ticket Information: Tickets are $25 general admission or $10 for students with ID. Tickets can be purchased online at www.MUTicketsOnline.com

event.location: The Ware Center, Millersville University Lancaster

event.title: A Lecture by Artist Robert E. Allen: "Creative Evolution: The Craft of Robert E. Allen"
event.shortdesc: The Ware Center and the National Association of Watch and Clock Collectors Earl Strickler Chapter7 are proud to host a lecture by the prestigious international sculptor Robert E. Allen.

fulldesc.p: Description: The Ware Center, Millersville University Lancaster and the National Association of Watch and Clock Collectors Earl Strickler Chapter7 are proud to host a lecture by the prestigious international sculptor Robert E. Allen. A specialist in sculptural horology, with studios in Lancaster City, Allen will discuss the the creative and technical processes behind the art and science of casting bronze and more exotic metals into clocks and watches.
Robert's lecture will be a fascinating look into "my obsession in making one-of-a-kind sculptural clocks" whose style he describes as "Medieval Futuristic."

An exhibition of his clockworks, watches, jewelry for men, bronze sculptures, glassworks runs through December 23, 2011 at The Ware Center. Open Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. His work is accompanied by a sideline display of the artwork of his wife, Susan Allen - a celebrated and nationally award-winning greeting card artist.
Ticket Information: The lecture is free and open to the public.

event.location: The Ware Center, Millersville University Lancaster

Baptista, a wealthy domineering father of two daughters, proclaims that his youngest and most desirable daughter, Bianca, may not be married until he “rids his hands” of his eldest daughter, Katharina – a notorious shrew. Bianca’s suitors are distraught realizing that no one but a fool will marry Kate. In walks Petruchio, far from foolish and flush with ego; seeing the prospects of a wealthy match for himself, he sets about to tame Kate into a “conforming wife”.
However things are not what they appear to be in Padua, Italy- neither are the people. Only one thing is sure – Love will bloom among the most unlikely of characters.

event.title: Lancaster Junior Orchestra and Lancaster Youth Symhony Concert
event.shortdesc: The Lancaster Junior Orchestra & Lancaster Youth Symphony join forces to present a holiday concert of classic holiday favorites.

fulldesc.p: Description: The Lancaster Junior Orchestra comprised of 75 students from public & private county schools grades 5 - 8, conducted by Janet Rawleigh presents a collection of holiday favorites including the Nutcracker Suite. This concert also features the Lancaster Youth Symphony which is made up of 75 students from Lancaster Country, grades 9 - 12, conducted by Fran Caravella.
Ticket Information: This concert is Free and open to the public.

event.location: The Ware Center, Millersville University Lancaster

event.title: Carrying Christmas Prima Style
event.shortdesc: Christmas PRIMA Sytle! "Carrying Christmas" written by Ron Barnett & Kristen Brewer puts a humorous twist on the holiday season.

fulldesc.p: Description: Carrying Christmas highlights the hilarity and warmth of the season woven through this beautiful song-cycle musical set in an intimate cabaret style. With songs like "Elves of the World, Unite," "Ho Ho Ho in Kokomo" and a cameo appearance from our manger scene bovine, this Christmas show can't be missed!

Ticket Information: General Admission tickets are $22 with premium tickets at $50 (include prime seating and a donation in your name to Water Street Rescue Mission). Sponsored by the Ware Center & Rodgers & Associates.

event.location: The Ware Center, Millersville University Lancaster

event.title: Creative Works' Presents Harry Kondoleon's "Christmas on Mars"
event.shortdesc: Christmas on Mars is a dark holiday comedy by Harry Kondoleon you won't want to miss! Presented by Creative Works of Lancaster

fulldesc.p: Description: A young couple, planning to marry now that she's pregnant, invite her mother to move in with them to help pay the rent. A lifelong friend arrives unexpectedly and decides to stay on. The four unlikely roommates look to the baby for redemption from the disappointments and emptiness of their own lives in this bizarre but moving comedy.
Ticket Information: Tickets for Christmas on Mars are $10 per person and are available by calling 717-723-8355 or visiting the website: www.creativelancaster.org.

event.location: The Ware Center Millersville University Lancaster

event.title: Nate Birkey Holiday Jazz Show
event.shortdesc: Jazz in the Sky presents Trumpeter Nate Birkey's Holiday Show. As a composer, trumpeter and vocalist, Nate imbues warmth and broiling energy into his music.

fulldesc.p: Description: Nate Birkey is an evocative trumpeter/vocalist/composer who bursts into true holiday mode with his new album Christmas. Accompanied by Steve Rudolph on piano and Keith Mohler on brass, Birkey will bring timeless emotion and spirituality to ageless classics such as, "O Tannenbaum," "Christmas Time is Here," and "I'll be Home for Christmas." He takes his audience on a delightful trip through the entire season with, "What are You Doing New Year's Eve," and "Hanukkah, Oh Hanukkah."

Christmas is Birkey's sixth album. Birkey mixes flugelhorn- a Christmas-spirited sound into the mix and brings to the holiday season a charisma and virtuosity of tone that will infuse audiences with the warmth and spirit of beloved musical memories.

Birkey is a Colorado native who had been honing his talents in the Santa Barbara Jazz scene, but in 2005 moved to New York where his artistic resolve truly evolved and where he finally received the national recognition he deserves. He is now considered one of Jazz's most promising, fast-rising musicians.

Ticket Information: Tickets are $15 per person with general admission seating. The concert is sponsored by The Ware Center & Rodgers & Associates; co-sponsored by Fine Living Lancaster Magazine & Veleska Jewelry.

event.ticketinfo: $15 each or $50 for a table of four

event.title: December Commencement 2011
event.shortdesc: December commencement will take place on Sunday, December 18 at 2 p.m.

fulldesc.p: Description: On Sunday, December 18, 2011 at 2 p.m., Millersville University will hold its December commencement ceremony in Pucillo Gymnasium. Kevin F. Harley, director of communications and press secretary for Governor Tom Corbett, will be the commencement speaker. Harley is a 1986 political science graduate of Millersville University.

Speaker Background: During his time at Millersville, Harley, of East Petersburg, Pa., received an Army ROTC scholarship and a commission upon graduation. He served 13 years as an officer in the Army Reserves. Harley is currently active in his community and has served on the East Petersburg Borough Council for the past 16 years and on the Hempfield Area Recreation Commission for the past 11 years.
For more information on December's commencement, visit Millersville University's Commencement website.

event.title: Dances of the Season
event.shortdesc: Dance Mosaic & Dance Discovery of Lancaster present Dances of the Season under the artistic direction of Valerie Henry. The program will be presented on December 18 at 4 p.m.

fulldesc.p: Description: Dances of the Season will feature Ballet, Modern, World & Liturgical Dances choreographed by Valerie Henry, artistic director of Dance Mosaic & Dance Discovery of Lancaster. The program will also include a dance suite from Handel's Messiah in keeping with the holiday season.

Ticket Information: Tickets cost $12 per person and may be purchased at www.muticketsonline.com. The Dances of the Season will held at The Ware Center and is sponsored by the Ware Center Millersville Lancaster & Rodgers & Associates.
